√¢¬õ¬∞√Ø¬∏¬è The Content Producer role

We're seeking a Content Producer to transform raw audio, video, and other materials into compelling short-form videos, polished audio assets, and interactive content for garden3d. You'll identify the most impactful soundbites and moments, then craft them into narratives that authentically represent our collective across social media, long-form platforms, and interactive experiences.

Your editorial eye and taste are key. We need someone who instinctively recognizes what resonates. What stops the scroll, builds connection, and feels distinctly garden3d. You'll develop a cohesive visual and sonic signature while working autonomously to bring stories to life with strong pacing, composition, and narrative sensibility.

Technically, you should be proficient in video editing, audio production, color grading, and motion graphics using tools like Adobe Premiere, After Effects, and audio editing software like Ableton Live or similar. You'll add transitions, effects, and captions to deliver professional-grade content optimized for each platform, working efficiently across formats and technical requirements.

Responsibilities:

  • Content Strategy & Curation
    • Review and audit raw video, audio, and multimedia assets from across garden3d studios
    • Identify standout moments, quotes, and visual elements that align with brand voice and platform best practices
    • Develop content calendars and storylines that showcase our work, culture, and values
    • Stay ahead of platform trends and algorithm changes to maximize reach and engagement
  • Brand Voice & Creative Direction
    • Develop and maintain a cohesive visual and sonic identity across all content
    • Exercise strong editorial judgment to ensure content authentically represents garden3d's values and aesthetic
    • Experiment with new formats, styles, and approaches to keep content fresh and engaging
    • Balance creativity with strategic goals to drive awareness, engagement, and community building
  • Video Production & Editing
    • Edit short-form video content optimized for Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, YouTube Shorts, and other platforms
    • Apply color grading, motion graphics, transitions, and effects to create polished, on-brand content
    • Add captions, subtitles, and text overlays for accessibility and engagement
    • Ensure proper aspect ratios, file formats, and technical specifications for each platform
  • Audio Production
    • Clean, mix, and master audio from interviews, podcasts, and internal recordings
    • Create audio snippets and soundbites for social media, podcasts, and promotional use
    • Add music, sound design, and audio effects to enhance storytelling
    • Optimize audio levels and quality for various distribution channels
  • Collaboration & Communication
    • Work closely with leadership and team members to understand project goals and messaging priorities
    • Provide creative input and recommendations on how to best capture and share our work
    • Communicate progress, timelines, and deliverables clearly and proactively
    • Operate autonomously while remaining open to feedback and iteration
  • Performance & Optimization
    • Monitor content performance metrics and audience engagement across platforms
    • Use insights to refine content strategy and improve future output
    • Test different formats, hooks, and storytelling approaches to maximize impact
    • Archive and organize assets for future use and reference

Qualifications

This is a great opportunity for someone looking to make a significant impact in a growing, dynamic company. You√¢¬Ä¬ôll be a key partner in shaping our financial future while ensuring we remain a sustainable and thriving organization.

Based on the responsibilities of this role, we think the right candidate has at least 5+ years in a similar role, sporting the following experience and skills:

√∞¬ü¬î¬ë Must have:

  • 5+ years of experience in video editing and content production, with a strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in short-form video for social media platforms
  • Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, and other industry-standard video editing tools
  • Strong audio production skills, including experience with mixing, mastering, and audio editing software (e.g., Ableton Live, Adobe Audition, or similar)
  • Demonstrated editorial judgment and ability to identify compelling moments and narratives from raw footage
  • Deep understanding of platform-specific best practices and content optimization for Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, YouTube Shorts, and emerging platforms
  • Experience with color grading, motion graphics, and visual effects to create polished, professional content
  • Strong storytelling abilities with excellent pacing, composition, and narrative sensibility
  • Ability to work autonomously while managing multiple projects and deadlines efficiently
  • Exceptional analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Able to be online between Pacific Standard Time (UTC-8) and Central European Time (UTC+2).

√∞¬ü¬ß¬Å Nice-to-have:

  • Fluency in AI tools like RunwayML, Midjourney, Fuser Studio, etc
  • Fluency in node-based tools like TouchDesigner, MaxMSP
  • Experience with OBS, live streaming and real-time content production
  • Knowledge of 3D animation, CGI, or immersive media production
  • Background in documentary filmmaking or long-form storytelling
  • Experience working with creative agencies, design studios, or technology collectives
  • Proficiency with additional creative tools such as DaVinci Resolve, Final Cut Pro, or Blender
  • Background in photography or graphic design to complement video work
  • Experience creating content for creative audiences, strategy consultancies, and/or thought leadership platforms
  • Ability to create interactive content or experiences for web and mobile platforms
  • Experience with community management and audience engagement strategies
  • Understanding of content performance metrics and data-driven optimization strategies

√∞¬ü¬ß¬ó Who you are

The person we√¢¬Ä¬ôre looking for is happy, relaxed and easy to get along with and appreciates a commitment to a culture of transparency, non-dictatorial leadership styles, and alternative methodologies. They√¢¬Ä¬ôre flexible on anything except conceits that will lower their usually outstanding work quality. They work √¢¬Ä¬úsmart√¢¬Ä¬ù by carefully managing their workflow and team.

√∞¬ü¬é¬§ How we interview

After you submit your application, a member of our team will reach out. Our interview process starts with an intro call to answer any questions you have about the role and to learn a bit more about your experience and interests.

From there, we√¢¬Ä¬ôll follow up with a panel interview call where you get to meet a few members of our team, to openly discuss some of our challenges and ensure your skills and interests align with where we√¢¬Ä¬ôre going as a business.

For qualified candidates, the process wraps with a reference call, and an offer to follow.

√∞¬ü¬ë¬©√¢¬Ä¬ç√∞¬ü¬è¬≠ How we work:

We believe that there√¢¬Ä¬ôs a better balance between the poles of freelancing & full time, and for that reason Sanctuary works differently to most shops:

  • Transparency & Ownership:√Ç¬†We release out Profit & Loss statements to the community each year, open source our best ideas, and talk business & money with everyone in the company. We√¢¬Ä¬ôre proud to run our business with integrity, and for that reason we share everything with our team & community.
  • 150% Carbon Negative: Our studio offsets 150% of the carbon we use to do business each year, dated back to our founding in 2015. We turn down work that is not in-line with our morals, and we encourage our peers to do the same. We have been certified climate neutral since 2021.
  • Strong Morals:√Ç¬†Since our founding, we've turned down somewhere between $1mm - $2mm of work that didn't meet our moral standards. (Most of that was DTC brands that can't show a valid sustainability initiative).
  • Async & Decentralized: We use tools optimized for calm, thoughtful communication, and opt for async whenever possible. We fight hard to maintain our focus time.
  • Remote Friendly:√Ç¬†Our company is fluent in remote work, making our workplace more decentralized, and democratized in the process.
  • Ideas & Products:√Ç¬†In our spare studio time, we work to build our own open source or internal products to diversify & bolster our income. We create amazing technology products for our clients, so why not for the studio?

√¢¬Ü¬í Read more on our Substack, over here, or our Medium, over there.

title: Product Engineer
description:
About PostHog

We're shipping every product that companies need to run their business from their first day, to the day they IPO, and beyond. The operating system for folks who build software.

We started with open-source product analytics, launched out of Y Combinator's W20 cohort. We've since shipped more than a dozen products, including:

  • A built-in data warehouse, so users can query product and customer data together using custom SQL insights.

  • A customer data platform, so they can send their data wherever they need with ease.

  • PostHog AI, an AI-powered analyst that answers product questions, helps users find useful session recordings, and writes custom SQL queries.

Next on the roadmap are CRM, messaging, revenue analytics, and support products. When we say every product that companies need to run their business, we really mean it!

We are:

  1. Product-led. More than 100,000 companies have installed PostHog, mostly driven by word-of-mouth. We have intensely strong product-market fit.

  2. Default alive. Revenue is growing 10% MoM on average, and we're very efficient. We raise money to push ambition and grow faster, not to keep the lights on.

  3. Well-funded. We've raised more than $100m from some of the world's top investors. We're set up for a long, ambitious journey.

We're focused on building an awesome product for end users, hiring exceptional teammates, shipping fast, and being as weird as possible.


Things we care about

  • Transparency: Everyone can read about our roadmap, how we pay (or even let go of) people, our strategy, and how we work, in our public company handbook. Internally, we share revenue, notes and slides from board meetings, and fundraising plans, so everyone has the context they need to make good decisions.

  • Autonomy: We don√¢¬Ä¬ôt tell anyone what to do. Everyone chooses what to work on next based on what's going to have the biggest impact on our customers, and what they find interesting and motivating to work on. Engineers lead product teams and make product decisions. Teams are flexible and easy to change when needed.

  • Shipping fast: Why not now? We want to build a lot of products; we can't do that shipping at a normal pace. We've built the company around small teams √¢¬Ä¬ì autonomous, highly-efficient groups of cracked engineers who can outship much larger companies because they own their products end-to-end.

  • Time for building: Nothing gets shipped in a meeting. We're a natively remote company. We default to async communication √¢¬Ä¬ì PRs > Issues > Slack. Tuesdays and Thursdays are meeting-free days, and we prioritize heads down building time over perfect coordination. This will be the most productive job you've ever had.

  • Ambition: We want to solve big problems. We strongly believe that aiming for the best possible upside, and sometimes missing, is better than never trying. We're optimistic about what's possible and our ability to get there.

  • Being weird: Weird means redesigning an already world-class website for the 5th time. It means shipping literally every product that relates to customer data. It means building an objectively unnecessary developer toy with dubious shareholder value. Doing weird stuff is a competitive advantage. And it's fun.

Who we're looking for

We're hiring for a range of roles here. What you end up working on will depend on your exact skillset and preferences, so choose your own adventure.

In general we seek Product Engineers who are:

  • Enthusiastic drivers. We need proactive people that can fully own projects and get them done, and know to get help when needed. This is what being a product engineer is all about. "Are we there yet?" is the wrong question.

  • Optimistic problem solvers. Things get hard here sometimes √¢¬Ä¬ì whether it's scaling, shipping complex products, handling a stream of support requests, or trying to ship something that touches multiple teams. We need people who won't get disheartened, and will collaborate, iterate, and ship their way out of anything.

  • Grown ups. We√¢¬Ä¬ôre an international bunch of weirdos, but one thing unites us: everyone is kind, considerate, and professional towards each other. This isn't about age or experience, it's about being low-ego, flexible, and respectful.

  • Genuine builders. PostHog is full of people who just love building stuff, people who would still be building software even if there wasn't a paycheck at the end. If this sounds like you, we should talk.


Right now, we are also looking for:

  • IAM specialist: You√¢¬Ä¬ôll design and ship core features like SAML support, new identity providers, and even our own IAM system. Start with internal tooling, then roll them out to customers. Tell us how you√¢¬Ä¬ôd make these systems so solid that other teams can build on them without hesitation.


What you'll be doing

  • Owning products and features from beginning to end. This means originating ideas based on your intuition, talking to users, and understanding our strategy and goals. It means testing MVPs in production with real users. It means iterating on their feedback, owning pricing, and ensuring the ongoing success of your work.

  • Collaborating with design (when necessary). Product engineers at PostHog are full stack, so we expect you to ship and own the basic UX of your work using our design system. From there, it's up to you to decide when to collaborate with our design team to iterate and polish the experience.

  • Talking to users. Good product engineers read feedback from users and iterate quickly. Great product engineers have users they're friendly with, talk with them frequently, bounce ideas off them, and iterate with them when they ship new things.

  • Doing support. Every week, one person in each engineering team is designated the Support hero. Their job is to investigate and resolve issues reported by customers for their product. Giving users support from real engineers, and shipping fixes and improvements in real-time, is one of the best ways to spark joy in users. This role will also include some on-call time, too.

  • Writing docs. We have a content team that will collaborate with you on reviewing, polishing, and improving your documentation, but the best person to document a new feature is the person who built it.

Requirements

  • Full-stack experience with relevant technologies √¢¬Ä¬ì e.g. Python or similar, React or similar, something to do with big data is a bonus.

  • Experience taking a project from 0 to 1. You might have led a project, been a founder previously, or built an impressive side project.

  • Strong writing skills. We document everything, most of it publicly. The ability to communicate your ideas and make persuasive arguments is essential.

Nice to have

  • Have worked at a high-growth SaaS company before.

  • Extensive knowledge of Django and/or TypeScript-based React.

  • Experience building AI-native products, or integrating AI into existing software.


If you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you - we're happy to accommodate!
